item.title: [Misc] Survivor:Adiart [Final Tribal Council]
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
Hippolytus:

I had 2 final 3 alliances, 1 with squid and waz and one with tele abd Isaac. Both were super loyal and its no coincedence the final 5 consisted of me and everyone in my final deals.

A big move was at final 10 having tele and isaac vote out you Simon, but i voted with squid u and waz even though I knew you were going home and wanted u gone. The second u were gone I made a group chat with waz and squid solidifying a final 3 and i had no blood on my hands cuz i never actually voted u out.

This meant at final 9 i had myself and 4 ppl who i was strong allies with. 5/9 is majority and everyone who wasnt in a final 3 with went home one by one.

(The reason i wanted u gone was cuz u were leading our alliance and i knew i didnt wanna go to the end with u anyway cuz you would win. Sorry)

Hippolytus:

Despite being labeled as a jury threat in the second post merge challenge where people voted on their opiniions about other players, I didnt recieve any votes in all the postmerge (apart from a cheeky selfvote).

In addition I knew who was going home every tribal council apart from this last one (i knew it was me or isaac but i thought itd go to 1 v 1). Tele was blindsided by the Jgoes vote and Waz by the first Simon vote and Squid vote. I knew and participated in all these votes (along with Isaac, my closest ally).

Hippolytus:

For the record the reason I voted squid out first was cuz I knew I wanted to sit with Waz and Isaac at the end based on the f10 questions challenge answers and I knew I could convince Isaac to yeet Tele at f4 but couldnt convince waz to yeet Squid at f4.

Squid is also very respected and is a mod and shit and im p sure theyd win in a f3 of me waz squid.

Sadly Tele is a challenge beast and won immunity and then waz found the idol so my plan was fucked.

Hippolytus:

Tele would be gone if they didnt win immunity.

Hippolytus:

In response I will say that at no point in the game did I ever need to win a challenge. Why make my threat level bigger (esp after opinion challenge when I was paranoid) by doing well in challenges.

We saw what happened to all the big threats at start of merge: eevee, pkr, marshall and Simon all went one by one. Mitigating threat level and staying under radar is p important.

Hippolytus:

I dont think you should vote me over tele because she wasnt loyal. At times I wasnt either, and thats the point of the game. Neither of us were ever disloyal to be a dick anyway, it was all strategy.

I do think you should vote me over tele because at several points in the game i had the chance to eliminate tele but I didnt. Realistically at no point could tele have voted me out.

Hippolytus:

Challenges is literally one small aspect of the game. There’s a bunch of other stuff going on with alliances and social stuff that is more important in my opinion.

I didn’t play to make the game interesting, I played the smartest game for me to get to the end with people I wanted to sit next to at the end. I do think I didn’t play that boring though - at final 7 I sent Jgoes home which he wasnt expecting, at final 6 I organised Simon going home which they weren’t expecting, at final 5 I voted out Squid which they weren’t expecting, and at final 4 I would have voted out Tele which they weren’t expecting. Saying “I didn’t see you guys try therefore you didn’t” is a fallacy.

Tele, me, and Waz all tried and all deserve to be here.

@eevee a summary of my game. i did play quite hard. if u have any questions ask.

Read full topic

item.title: [Misc] Survivor:Adiart [Final Tribal Council]
item.dc:creator: Wazza
item.description:
I settled on my alliance as I felt like we could get to the final together, we all trusted each other entirely and we didn’t want to break that at first, I just kept with my team until I knew I had to go solo, I took priority for myself and then went for the team towards the end.

Read full topic

item.title: [Misc] Survivor:Adiart [Final Tribal Council]
item.dc:creator: Teleology
item.description:
Yeah I wouldn’t fault Hippo on that one I guess

But 1. I haven’t received any warnings, and have submitted something for every challenge and have voted every time
2. I didn’t settle on my alliance and I tried to seek out people who I thought would be loyal and honest with me
3. I’ve been really elaborate with my answers if you look at my first post. I am trying just trying unconventionally

Read full topic

item.title: [Misc] Survivor:Adiart [Final Tribal Council]
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
2 of my strikes were in premerge when I said I had no wifi for a while.

In the postmerge I was safe every vote and had no need to win immunity. It’s not all about immunity.

And waz is absolutely right that even tho this thread wasn’t busy everyone was busy talking in PM chains.

Read full topic

item.title: [Misc] Survivor:Adiart [Final Tribal Council]
item.dc:creator: Wazza
item.description:
PokemonKidRyan:

Was there anyone you wanted to keep in but became too much of a threat?

At first, I’d have to say Eevee, but I knew I’d never stay in with him so I’m going with Simon here.

PokemonKidRyan:

Do you regret any decisions you made?

I regret not helping Squid win the Idol.

eevee-sama:

Most people who reached late game should be kicked long ago for inactivity.

Inactivity can’t be proven though, that’s the problem in these types of games.

eevee-sama:

n challange which could get you to final 4, 2 people didnt submit score. In challange which… took 2 minutes to complete.

eevee-sama:

Oh, did I tell you that best score living people had was 2k ppinrs, while dead had 12k?

99% sure we all saw it, Eevee.

eevee-sama:

How about QWOP? Nah… only dead people finished the race.

I had a funeral on that day and after I got home the challenge was over. I thought I’d have more time but my mum got drunk and we stayed for 6 hours longer.

eevee-sama:

Did any of you even searched for idol before basicly being shown it in the face?

I technically did. Even if you say it didn’t count, I’m counting it.

eevee-sama:

Did any of you hide any fake idols?

nope.

eevee-sama:

Did any of you join 3rd tribe? That’s a no.

I’d rather stick with my OG’s than join a new tribe that was going to be merged literally 1-2 games later.

eevee-sama:

What I saw ypu do was eliminating people who actualy cared. And that’s even worse than actually not carying itself.

We eliminated threats, me, Squid and Hippo were always communicating.

eevee-sama:

Was whatever your plan was worth destroying fun for other people?

Isn’t this game literally about winning? Fun isn’t an option here. Hell, I had barely any fun, apart from the challenges. There wasn’t much to do, no one wanted to interact with the other team and no one had any idea Hippo was even on the other side.

eevee-sama:

Making end of game a joke of inactivity rather than struggle for power it should be?

Sorry but I’m 99% sure the final 5 were all active, just not all together or in public (Well apart from Isaac, I have no idea with him)

eevee-sama:

What did you do to make game interesting? Convince me to vote for you.

Mine’s more than likely going to be the worst to convince you. But it’s worth a shot.

I was honest the entire game about my actions (Yeah, cliche and not what a person wanting to win should do). I had a plan from the start, make people forget that I existed, I didn’t want to cause beef or drama, and I didn’t want to be seen as a threat, but I also didn’t want to be seen as a failure, I usually went towards the middle for challenges so I wasn’t an easy pick to go out. I also tried my hardest during the last few tribal’s to stay in, which was mostly just an act of desperation as I will admit. But I felt like I had a need to win at that point, in a challenge everyone said I would be least likely to win, and it really doesn’t seem like I’ll win at all to be honest, but I just wanted to prove myself I guess. I didn’t make the game interesting, all I did was play for myself, I know it’s not the answer you asked for but it’s the answer you got.

eevee-sama:

See, I didn’t lie whole game either. And I’m staying true to my own PoV.

The thing about you though, is that you didn’t play low. You went out full honesty mode and told everything. You were too open about yourself. I was honest, but not open unless approached.

eevee-sama:

But Wazza and Hippo should of been kicked long ago for strikes.

Why would I have been kicked long ago for strikes? I literally got 1 strike and that’s because I didn’t realise voting had started.

Read full topic

item.title: [Misc] Survivor:Adiart [Final Tribal Council]
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
Did you read my strategy posts?

item.title: [Misc] Survivor:Adiart [Final Tribal Council]
item.dc:creator: eevee
item.description:
Yes, I plaied to what I think was best way to make game more interesting, both for me and others.

I’m not after compliments or being salty.
I’m after finally understanding what you were doing whole game.

Like I can still understand Tele did something.

But Wazza and Hippo should of been kicked long ago for strikes.
That’s why I want to give all of you a chance to prove you actually did something, instead of just slanking.

Read full topic

item.title: [Misc] Survivor:Adiart [Final Tribal Council]
item.dc:creator: eevee
item.description:
Sigh. That’s not what I’m after ffs.

I want to know what you did to make game more interesting. Alliances, stuff.
How am I supposed to know what you did in shadows whole game?

It’s time to finally reveal, what you people did.

I can see only obvious stuff, and obvious is that none of you was idol hunting and that most of you didn’t bother to submit challanges.
I wanted final 3 to prove to me that you deserve to win, not that you was just slanking all game.

Read full topic
